mobs.long_desc: A shapeless mound of stone shifts slightly at your approach.
mobs.desc: At first glance the mound before you seems to be composed of nothing more than ordinary stone.  But as you approach, the mound shifts and quivers and forms into a being made of living rock!  The Earth Elemental is slow and ponderous but exudes raw power.

mobs.long_desc: A large black cat peers at you from atop a skeleton.
mobs.desc: There is something very peculiar about this cat...  It is twice the size of a household cat, for one thing, and it lacks the vacant, mindless stare of the common cat.  As you peer into its luminous eyes, you become aware that this is an intelligent and cunning creature.  Stories and legends dance through your mind...  Campfire tales of creature conjured to guard the dead...  Creatures which take the shape of a large black cat....

mobs.long_desc: A nomadic Jann is here, exploring the tunnel.
mobs.desc: The man standing before you belongs to a unique race of humanoids that are able to travel freely throughout the elemental planes.  Recognized as a native son on whatever plane he travels to, the Jann are allowed to pass through the various planes uncontested.  The Jann were once a nomadic people and they view the land their ancestors traveled upon as their sacred territory.  They will assault anyone who intrudes upon this land.

mobs.long_desc: A man with evil eyes is here, regarding you from the shadows.
mobs.desc: Tall and muscular, the man standing before you is a competent warrior.  His eyes are crafty and the arrogant expression on his face indicates that he is as likely to rip your heart out as give you the time of day.  Wanted for multiple counts of savage murder in the town of Anduin, this man won't let himself be taken alive, if you are foolish enough to attempt capturing him.

mobs.long_desc: A ghastly apparition materializes before you.
mobs.desc: Before you floats the spirit of an ancient warrior.  Long ago the warrior accompanied Severan on his Quest to save the Princess, but fell in these tunnels to the armies of Lokari.  After his death, his body was recovered by Lokari's clerics, and through foul magic they enslaved his spirit and forced him to serve in death the god he opposed in life.

mobs.long_desc: A rotting corpse with fiery eyes charges toward you!
mobs.desc: A great leader of men in the living world, the undead captain continues to lead a host of ghostly companions after her death. Although the captain's soul has long since fled her corporeal form, her body is powered by the sinister necromancers that once served Lokari.

mobs.long_desc: A being made of living rock towers over you.
mobs.desc: In every detail he looks like a man, save that he is made from solid stone.  A strange grace permeates his movements, something that wouldn't normally spring to mind when thinking about creatures which resemble the very bones of the earth.  Here in the heart of the Realm of Earth, though, such a being is possible.

mobs.long_desc: An Ogre dressed in ragged clothing shouts a challenge at you.
mobs.desc: Several feet taller than a man, and heavily built, the ogre is a formidable opponent in battle, whether he wields a weapon or not.  It is known that a determined ogre, swinging his balled fists like mallets, can burst through a stone wall, given time.  This particular ogre is a descendant of one of Lokari's servants.  When Lokari's armies were defeated here, a small band of ogres escaped the massacre and and have haunted these tunnels since.

mobs.long_desc: A huge worm thrusts its way through the stone.
mobs.desc: The stone around this worm shimmers and has an unreal aspect, as through the worm is able to alter the substance of the rock so it can slide through. The worm flails about blindly for a moment before sensing your presence. Perhaps it can detect your footfall, or hear your breathing, or pinpoint you with its sense of smell; whatever its method of detection, the worm is now aware of your presence and only your battle prowess has a chance of stopping the worm before it makes you its next meal...

mobs.long_desc: A dark-skinned, stout creature blocks your path.
mobs.desc: The creature standing before you resembles a dwarf, but is unlike any dwarf you have ever seen before. The black dwarf seems to have a closer affinity for rock than his earthly cousins, but his strong bond to stone comes at the expense of humanoid qualities shared by man and dwarf alike. The dwarf's eyes are as dark as his skin and lack hint of either compassion or malice. He seems as strong as unyielding as stone itself.

mobs.long_desc: A tall man with a severe face regards you silently.
mobs.desc: The Oracle of Rhalean is a man with a severe, almost cold face.  At first glance, he certainly does not inspire you with confidence in Rhalean, the goddess of Justice.  However, as you inspect him further you become amazed with the wisdom and intelligence you detect in his eyes.  This is a man who is trained to administer justice.  You believe him to be wise and fair in his dealings with the accused, but harsh in his treatment of the guilty.

mobs.short_desc: the Oracle of the Wild Hunt
mobs.long_desc: The Oracle of the Wild Hunt awaits your coming.
mobs.desc: The Oracle of the Hunt is a beautiful woman of indeterminate age.  She seems pure of mind and spirit, though you can't quite figure out why you think this. As the Avatar of the Incarnation of Good, she stands tall and proud, almost arrogant.  Her ice-blue eyes, so like the goddess' own, watch you without emotion.  Her light robe almost hides the contours of her shapely body--is that a bikini under the robe?  You can't tell in the moonlight.  All in all, this warrior woman looks formidable, muscled, strong, proud, and confident.

mobs.long_desc: The Oracle of the Sun is here, outrage evident in his stance.
mobs.desc: The Oracle is dressed in armor decorated with the holy symbols of the Order of Paladins.  Noble in bearing, yet aged, it is nonetheless clear that this is a mighty warrior standing here.  Basking in the light of his god, Timun's Oracle stands watch over the Gateway that leads to the Realms bordering Lokari's, keeping the inexperienced out of harm's way.

mobs.long_desc: The Keeper of the Keys is here, preparing to test your worth.
mobs.desc: The Keeper of the Keys is a tall, alien-looking woman.  Her ears mark her as an elf, but there is something very unwordly in her luminous green eyes.  After a moment's consideration, you recognize her as one of the legendary Jann, a race of humanoids formed from the elemental planes themselves.

mobs.long_desc: A shapeless mound of stone shifts slightly at your approach.
mobs.desc: At first glance the mound before you seems to be composed of nothing more than ordinary stone. But as you approach, the mound shifts and quivers and forms into a being made of living rock! The Earth Elemental is slow and ponderous but exudes raw power.

mobs.long_desc: A fiery form flows in your direction.
mobs.desc: As you peer at this strange being you try to make some sense of it.  Wholly composed of fire, the elemental has a self-awareness and a sort of limited intelligence.  It exists for the sole purpose of burning and destroying everything that stands in its path.  The fire elemental takes pleasure is fulfilling its purpose, but would be unable to classify its acts as either good or evil: the elemental simply performs its inborn task, without regard to the consequences.

mobs.long_desc: A creature with thick bark-like skin and a wild expression is here, weeping.
mobs.desc: The creature before you is an odd mixture of humanity and nature.  Although much taller than a man, the tremaen is roughly humanoid in shape.  It has distinguishable features, such as legs and arms and a face, but its skin is barky, and its hair is green and flows down to its knees.  The tremaen is normally a gentle creature, but its eyes glint with a madness capable of extreme violence.  Perhaps the devastation wrought by the fire has driven the tremaen out of its mind.

mobs.long_desc: A golem made of mud and forest litter steps out of the shadows.
mobs.desc: The golem before you is awkward and crudely made.  Its movements are irregular and slow, but with a certain dull purpose.  Although it is made primarily of mud, wood, and rotting debris, the golem appears to be solidly constructed. The golem is unconcerned with the fire and focuses upon the single task it was invested with: protecting the forest from intruders.

mobs.long_desc: A thick root erupts from the forest floor and entangles you!
mobs.desc: Thick and long, this root waves madly about.  It seems to possess a limited intelligence and is intent upon twisting itself around your neck.

mobs.long_desc: The elder tremaen is here, ignoring the fire which blazes around him.
mobs.desc: By far this is the largest tremaen you have ever encountered.  The elder's eyes are wild and you know the madness has infected this tremaen as well. Occasionally the elder focuses its eyes upon empty air and bellows commands. You believe that in its insanity the elder is reliving past battles.

mobs.long_desc: There is a disturbance in the air here.
mobs.desc: The being before you is without definite shape or form.  However, there is a certain solidity to its form.  It seems to be going about the forest performing simple tasks.  The aerial servant is a being from the plane of air, coerced by powerful magics to serve the man who summoned it.

mobs.long_desc: A wizened old man is here, attempting to put out the fire.
mobs.desc: This old druid has wrinkled skin and tangled hair, but there is a nearly palpable aura of power which emanates from his crippled form.  He is rushing about the forest in a vain attempt to put out the fires.  He frequently reaches out to caress a tree trunk or bough.  His touch calms the panicked trees.

mobs.long_desc: A man with flames rippling along his magma skin whirls toward you.
mobs.desc: Flames ripple like muscles along the form of the creature standing before you. The efreeti has assumed a humanoid form, but with that magma red skin and flaming form you would never mistake him for a human.  The efreeti dances as nimbly as flame as he fights, making him difficult to hit in battle.

mobs.long_desc: A dwarf with flames flickering from his body stands guard here.
mobs.desc: This creature bears many resemblances to a dwarf, such as his short stature and his grandiose beard.  However, it is obvious this being is a child of the fire plane, for flames rise spontaneously from his skin and dance within his beard, apparently without causing him any harm.

mobs.long_desc: A dwarf with a braided beard and flames for hair stands here.
mobs.desc: Flames flicker along this dwarf creature's skin, apparently without causing him injury.  His eyes are blood red and regard you violently.

mobs.long_desc: A dwarf with flames for hair regards you confidently.
mobs.desc: From his stance and his poise, you deduce that this dwarf is a master warrior. Flames rise from his skull like hair.

mobs.long_desc: A fiery form flows in your direction.
mobs.desc: As you peer at this strange being you try to make some sense of it.  Wholly composed of fire, the elemental has a self-awareness and a sort of limited intelligence.  It exists for the sole purpose of burning and destroying everything that stands in its path.  The fire elemental takes pleasure is fulfilling its purpose, but would be unable to classify its acts as either good or evil: the elemental simply performs its inborn task, without regard to the consequences.

mobs.long_desc: A fiery form flows in your direction.
mobs.desc: As you peer at this strange being you try to make some sense of it.  Wholly composed of fire, the elemental has a self-awareness and a sort of limited intelligence.  It exists for the sole purpose of burning and destroying everything that stands in its path.  The fire elemental takes pleasure is fulfilling its purpose, but would be unable to classify its acts as either good or evil: the elemental simply performs its inborn task, without regard to the consequences.

mobs.long_desc: &2&bA crop of wriggling roots wriggles here.&0
mobs.desc: This mob should never be seen.  It is used as part of the mighty druid's entanglement script.

mobs.long_desc: &2&bA crop of wriggling roots wriggles here.&0
mobs.desc: This mob should never be seen.  It is used as part of the mighty druid's entanglement script.

mobs.long_desc: &2&bA crop of wriggling roots wriggles here.&0
mobs.desc: This mob should never be seen.  It is used as part of the mighty druid's entanglement script.

mobs.long_desc: A mound of snow and dirty ice shambles toward you.
mobs.desc: The creature before you is formed from compacted snow and ice. It appears slow but deadly. The creature glares at you fiercely but seems quite frightened of you- perhaps it has never before encountered beings that radiated such intense heat.

mobs.long_desc: A spinning column of water rises from the ocean and surges toward you.
mobs.desc: Before you is a spinning column of water which has risen from the sea and dances upon the ocean. The column seems sentient, for when it spots you, it heads straight for you with all the speed of a crashing wave....

mobs.long_desc: A squat being made of blue ice rests here.
mobs.desc: The Lord of the Ice Elementals is much smaller than the beings it rules over. Perhaps its dominance rests in the fact that it is composed entirely of a pure, light blue ice. The composition of this elemental certainly sets it apart from its subjects, which are formed from simple snow and dirty ice.

mobs.long_desc: A regal man of giant proportions greets you cordially.
mobs.desc: The race of the Titans are viewed by many people to be a race of gods. In truth, they are mortal, though they measure their lives by thousands of years. Titans are a noble, reserved people who prefer to spend their time away from others. They spend much time studying the natural world and are said to be very learned in the arts of astrology and alchemy.

mobs.long_desc: A dense sphere of fog hovers here.
mobs.desc: At first glance this seems to be nothing more than an oddly-shaped cloud of mist. However, as you examine its form carefully, you discover that the mist seems to possess a certain solidity.

mobs.long_desc: A monster conceived in the deepest water erupts from the surface.
mobs.desc: This monster thrashes about in the ocean, making the water turbulant and its form difficult to detect. You can see that its body is several meters in diameter and that its scales are silvery in color but beyond that you are unable to see much of this creature.

mobs.long_desc: A tall man with sickly green skin stands here, munching on a bone.
mobs.desc: In spite of the fact that the creature standing before you lives along a creek bank, it is obvious from the stench rolling off his body that he has not bathed in years, if ever. Surely, to kill such a repulsive monster would be to do the world a favor.

objects.ground: The remains of a heroic warrior have been placed here.

extras.text: The skeleton is laid in a position of honor. At her side lies an assortment of artifacts: a broken sword, an enemy's standard, an ogre's skull. If you search the skeleton carefully, you may find something of value, but the visible artifacts are worthless.

objects.ground: A key with the symbol of eternity etched onto its surface lies here.

extras.text: This key seems to throb with power. As you fondle this key something tells you it was fashioned by a god.

objects.ground: A beautiful staff made of ivory has been dropped here by a careless fool.

extras.text: This staff was carved from pure ivory. One end of the staff tapers off to an oddly shaped point. The point looks almost like a key.

objects.ground: A shield painted with images of heroism and valor lies here.

extras.text: The shield has many dents in it but seems quite sturdy.  The surface of the shield is painted with images of heroism and valor.  It original owner was surely a mighty warrior who held these values in high esteem.

objects.ground: A dagger with a narrow barbed blade lies here.

extras.text: The dagger's blade is so narrow it seems as though you could easily snap the weapon in two. However, when you test the strength of the weapon you find it is quite strong. The edge of the dagger is razor sharp. Clearly, this would make an ideal backstab weapon.

objects.ground: A heavy mallet lies on the floor here.

extras.text: The mallet is made entirely of metal. The black surface of the mallet seems too soak up your light. The weapon itself is heavy and, although slightly unwieldly in combat, would make an effective crushing weapon.

objects.ground: A decanter made of crystal is here, sparkling in the light.
A pair of spiked boots lie here.

extras.text: The boots are made of metal and seem quite heavy.  They will inhibit you in combat, but will provide unparalled protection for your tender feet.  The spikes project from the bottom of the boot and dig deep into the earth, providing you with excellent footing.

objects.ground: A staff made from the limb of a Silveroak tree lies here.

extras.text: This staff was made from the limb of a Silveroak tree. Perhaps the Druid who originally owned this powerful staff received it as a gift from the tree, for it is inconceivable that anyone would harm a Silveroak by cutting off a limb. The staff retains the tree's bark and shimmers brightly in the light.

objects.ground: A tiny nut with a silver sheen lies here.

extras.text: The Silveroak is a hardy, long-lived tree, but it rarely proliferates. Finding the seed of such a tree is truly a remarkable event.

objects.short: the limb of a maddened tremaen
objects.ground: A fire-scorched staff lies here, smoldering slightly.

extras.text: This limb broke off during a tremaen during battle.  The limb is sturdy and could make an effective weapon in battle.

objects.ground: A javelin with a broad brass head lies here.

extras.text: The javelin is made of brass and at first glance appears to be an inferior weapon. However, a close inspection of the weapon reveals that the metal has been enchanted or somehow enhanced, for the balance and strength of the javelin is superior to any other you have seen.

objects.ground: A brass kilt lies here in a pile.

extras.text: The kilt is worn over your legs.  It would look quite sexy on you; why not try it on?

objects.ground: A gleaming golden horn lies here.

extras.text: This beautifully worked horn is made of shiny gold.  It's pointed at one end, with a mouthpiece there of polished bone, and opens up like a cone.  It's suspended from a red cord that attaches to the horn in two places.  The horn is curved a little in the middle, the better to wrap around your waist a little as you wear the cord.  You feel a sense of power flow into your body as you consider the horn.  Perhaps this beautifully crafted horn, created and blessed by the Goddess of the Hunt, Azkrael, herself, will be just the thing you need to complete your quest to destroy Lokari.

objects.ground: A key made of pure sunlight lies here.

extras.text: This key is made of pure light! It throbs with power.

objects.ground: A sphere radiating an intense light lies here.

extras.text: This sphere is so radiant you can bearly stand to look at it. Upon the sphere, which is made of pure gold, are images of Timun, the Sun god.

objects.ground: A girth inlaid with precious stones lies here.

extras.text: This belt is made of a metal as while as snow itself. It is inlaid with precious stones.

objects.ground: A sphere radiating an intense light lies here.
objects.action_desc: $p flares brightly, throwing blinding light in all directions!

objects.ground: A glimmering portal stands here.
Highly embellished sapphire bracers lie here sparkling.

extras.text: Sparkling with some mysterious light, these bracers are indeed a work of art to behold.  Twin snake-like dragons are carved into the sapphire making up each bracer.  Each serpent has four claws and manes resembling bolts of lightning. A semicircular white diamond has been placed in each dragon's mouth, looking somewhat like a twisted crescent.  A tiny black dot appears slightly off-center in each diamond.  Beneath the sapphire exterior, layers of strong steel stand between the gemstone and the softer padding beneath.  There must be some sort of magical protection upon these bracers though, for such beautiful sapphire would never stand up against physical attack.

objects.short: the Mask of the Deepest Depths
objects.ground: A mask of the terrifying visage of a sea monster drifts here.

extras.text: This larger-than-life mask is made of silver scales stretched over a wide frame.  It depicts some kind of deep sea dragon.  The ferocious eyes are detailed in multicolored leather and scales.  The muzzle included an articulated lower jaw, allowing the mouth to open and close.  The mask is both ferocious and beautiful, ceremonial and martial.

objects.short: the antlers of a white hart
objects.ground: Pure white antlers lie discarded here.

extras.text: Glowing with a sacred power, these are the legendary antlers of the whitehart. They are said to be a mark of power, prosperity, and good fortune, as the white hart is a beast sacred to Azkrael of the Hunt.

objects.ground: A whitish rag lies here crumpled and bloodied.

extras.text: The rag is a large scrap of linen, soaked with acrid blood.  The blood remains strangely bright red, as if fresh.

objects.ground: A wax-stoppered lead vial lies here unattended.

extras.text: A warm, comforting heat comes from this vial.  If it were to be opened,what would it release?  Imprinted on the wax stopper is the ancient symbol for Timun, the sun god: a four-pointed sun symbol.  But it would take divine power to seal something immaterial inside a container....

objects.short: a map of the Caelian Region
objects.ground: A travel-stained map has been dropped here.

objects.short: a map of the forest town of Mielikki
objects.ground: A beautiful map, created with painstaking detail, has been dropped here.

objects.ground: A stiff tube of ivory and silver lies here.

extras.text: The tube is stiff so its contents will not get folded or torn. The tube has an opening at one end, perhaps you should glance inside?

triggers.name: keeper-keys-speech
triggers.commands: msend %actor% %self.name% eyes you mercilessly. mechoaround %actor% %self.name% eyes %actor.name% mercilessly. wait 1s if %actor.level% < 85 msend %actor% %self.name% says to you, 'You are far too weak to seek entry into msend %actor% &0the elemental planes.  Come back when you are stronger.' mechoaround %actor% %self.name% says to %actor.name%, 'You are far too weak to seek mechoaround %actor% &0entry into the elemental planes.  Come back when you are stronger.' elseif %actor.quest_stage[doom_entrance]% < 1 mecho %self.name% says, 'So, %actor.name%, you wish to seek entry into mecho &0Lokari's Keep?' elseif %actor.has_completed[doom_entrance]% mecho %self.name% says, 'Well done, %actor.name%! mecho &0Please take this key and with it our hopes.' mload obj 48401 give sacred-key %actor.name% bow say Use it well! end

triggers.name: oracle-sun-greet
triggers.commands: wait 2 if %wandstep% eval minlevel (%wandstep% - 1) * 10 elseif %macestep% eval minlevel %macestep% * 10 endif if %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% == %wandstep% && %actor.quest_stage[doom_entrance]% != 5 && %actor.quest_stage[doom_entrance]% != 6 && !%actor.has_completed[doom_entrance]% if %actor.level% >= %minlevel% if %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:greet]% == 0 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Timun, God of the Sun, sees you are progressing toward divine fire.  Tell us what you are working on.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Do you have what I require to craft your staff?' endif endif elseif %actor.quest_stage[phase_mace]% == %macestep% && %actor.quest_stage[doom_entrance]% != 5 && %actor.quest_stage[doom_entrance]% != 6 && !%actor.has_completed[doom_entrance]% if %actor.level% >= %minlevel% if %actor.quest_variable[phase_mace:greet]% == 0 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'I sense a ghostly presence about your weapons.  If you want my help, we can talk about &6&b[upgrades]&0.' else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Do you have what I need?' endif endif elseif %actor.quest_stage[doom_entrance]% == 5 bow %actor.name% wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'At last, one has come to challenge the wrath of the God of the Moonless Night.' wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You shall need Timun's Light if you are to defeat Lokari, %actor.name%.' mload obj 48431 give vial %actor.name% wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'You must take this vial to a place steeped in darkness.  You shall know it by the false light shed there and the mockery of the sun it proclaims.' wait 2s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Then drop it on the ground and fill the place with holy light!  Once you have completed this task, return to me and I shall inform the Keeper of the Keys that you are indeed worthy.' wait 4s if %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% == %wandstep% if %actor.level% >= %minlevel% if %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:greet]% == 0 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Additionally Timun, God of the Sun, sees you are progressing toward divine fire.  Tell us what you are working on.' wait 1s else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Do you have what I require to craft your staff?' wait 1s endif endif elseif %actor.quest_stage[phase_mace]% == %macestep% if %actor.level% >= %minlevel% if %actor.quest_variable[phase_mace:greet]% == 0 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Timun sees you also seek His lambent blessing to repel the forces of the dead.  Tell us what you are working on.' wait 1s else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Do you have what I require to bless your mace?' wait 1s endif endif endif msend %actor% With those words, the Oracle bows his head and refuses to utter another word. elseif %actor.quest_stage[doom_entrance]% == 6 set person %actor% set i %person.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[doom_entrance]% == 6 msend %person% %self.name% says, 'You have done well, %person.name%. Your task is completed.' wait 1s msend %person% %self.name% says, 'May the light of the Sun find you even in the depths of Severan's Doom.' quest complete doom_entrance %person.name% wait 1s msend %person% %self.name% says, 'Do not forget to show the Keeper of the Keys that you have finished!' endif elseif %person% eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done mload obj 48421 give key %actor.name% if %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% == %wandstep% eval minlevel (%wandstep% - 1) * 10 if %actor.level% >= %minlevel% wait 3s if %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:greet]% == 0 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Additionally Timun, God of the Sun, sees you are progressing toward divine fire.  Tell us what you are working on.' wait 1s else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Do you have what I require to craft your staff?' wait 1s endif endif elseif %actor.quest_stage[phase_mace]% == %macestep% if %actor.level% >= %minlevel% if %actor.quest_variable[phase_mace:greet]% == 0 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Timun sees you also seek His lambent blessing to repel the forces of the dead.  Tell us what you are working on.' wait 1s else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Do you have what I require to bless your mace?' wait 1s endif endif endif elseif %actor.has_completed[doom_entrance]% msend %actor% As you enter the chamber %self.name% greets you warmly. mechoaround %actor% %self.name% greets %actor.name% warmly. wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Heroes, the day of Prophecy has arrived.  Know that in a nearby chamber is a Gateway to another Realm.  From that Realm, you will have access to others; and it is in one of these other Realms that you will find the way to Lokari's Domain.' wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Collect the three godly keys to the Domain, which were scattered by the gods upon the Champion's death, and slay the mad god for his crimes.' wait 1s msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Go now, the Universe awaits!' wait 1s if %actor.quest_stage[%type%_wand]% == %wandstep% eval minlevel (%wandstep% - 1) * 10 if %actor.level% >= %minlevel% if %actor.quest_variable[%type%_wand:greet]% == 0 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Additionally Timun, God of the Sun, sees you are progressing toward divine fire.  Tell us what you are working on.' wait 1s else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Do you have what I require to craft your staff?' wait 1s endif elseif %actor.quest_stage[phase_mace]% == %macestep% if %actor.level% >= %minlevel% if %actor.quest_variable[phase_mace:greet]% == 0 msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Timun sees you also seek His lambent blessing to repel the forces of the dead.  Tell us what you are working on.' wait 1s else msend %actor% %self.name% says, 'Do you have what I require to bless your mace?' wait 1s endif endif endif endif msend %actor% With those words, the Oracle bows his head and refuses to utter another word. endif

triggers.name: justice-oracle-greet
triggers.commands: wait 2 set person %actor% set i %person.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% * * Added by Daedela 3-2021 for Wizard Eye * if %person.quest_stage[wizard_eye]% == 9 quest advance wizard_eye %person.name% msend %person% %self.name% says, 'I have foreseen this moment and anticipated your arrival.  If you seek my guidance, present to me the crystals in question.' else if %person.quest_stage[doom_entrance]% == 3 msend %person% %self.name% says, 'Greetings, %person.name%.' wait 2s msend %person% %self.name% says, 'It has come to my attention that you seek to prove your worth to Rhalean.  As the goddess of Justice, Rhalean has but one foe: her evil sister, trapped underground in the ages before the Riftwars.' wait 1s msend %person% %self.name% says, 'To prove yourself, return here after you have slain this vile creature.' elseif %person.quest_stage[doom_entrance]% == 4 quest advance doom_entrance %person.name% msend %person% &7&bYou have advanced the quest!&0 msend %person% %self.name% says, 'Excellent!' wait 1s msend %person% %self.name% says, 'You have proven yourself to Rhalean, %person.name%. Please, continue on to the Oracle of the Sun.' else msend %person% As thoughts of Justice run through your mind, the Oracle clenches a calloused hand. wait 1s msend %person% %self.name% says, 'All crimes may be forgiven, save the murder of innocents.  For this sin, even the gods must take reckoning.  For this reason, you must do what the gods are prevented from doing, and slay Lokari.' endif endif elseif %person% eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done

triggers.name: hunt-oracle-greet
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_stage[doom_entrance]% == 1 emote looks at %actor.name% once and nods. mecho %self.name% says, 'To prove to Azkrael that you are worthy of mecho &0seeking out her traitorous brother, you shall have to find and slay her mecho &0favorite prey, a white hart.' wait 1s mload obj 48430 give rag %actor.name% mecho %self.name% says, 'The white hart disguises itself as a mecho &0white-tailed deer.  But if you hold this rag in its presence, it will reveal mecho &0its true nature to you, %actor.name%.' wait 1s say All normal deer will simply flee. wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'Slay the hart and return its antlers to me mecho &0as proof.' elseif %actor.quest_stage[doom_entrance]% == 2 smile %actor.name% wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'Give me the antlers of the white hart, mecho &0%actor.name%.' else wait 1s mecho As you look at %self.name%, you get a sense of her power mecho &0and majesty. This is no ordinary warrior, no ordinary person. wait 2s mecho You realize it'd be a bad idea to attack her. mecho And, as if reading your mind to see that you've realized this, mecho &0the Oracle speaks, her voice like silver. wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'The Goddess Azkrael, protectress of mecho &0huntresses and virgins, was doubly outraged when Lokari took the honor, then mecho &0the life, of the woman Irinia, then abused her further by forcing her spirit mecho &0to serve his evil whims.' wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'Though Lokari be Azkrael's own brother-- mecho &0and a god-- he must be punished.' wait 3s mecho %self.name% says, 'Azkrael is forbidden to raise her hand mecho &0against Lokari herself, but if you will aid her, she will allow you the use mecho &0of the great Horn of the Hunt.  You will find it somewhere on one of the four mecho &0Elemental Planes.  Use it to gain entrance to Lokari's Keep, and set the ghost mecho &0of Irinia free.' wait 2s mecho The Oracle waits, as if expecting you to leave. She says no more. end

triggers.name: lord-realm-spawn
triggers.commands: *This is for room 47658: The Heart of the Realm. if !%lord_loaded% set lord_loaded 1 global lord_loaded wait 1s wecho Before your eyes, a nondescript boulder molds itself into the image of a man of gigantic proportions. wload mob 48406 wait 1s wecho When the transformation is complete, the elemental flexes his thick stone fingers fluidly. wforce lord-realm mload obj 48402 wforce lord-realm mat 1100 hold staff-justice wforce lord-realm shout It has been long since I have taken this form! Beware--this time I will be the victorious one! end

triggers.name: wild-hunt-rag-held
triggers.commands: *Checks to see if the actor is indeed holding the rag like they should be *for the doom entry quest. if %actor.quest_stage[doom_entrance]% == 1 if (%actor.wearing[48430]%) if %self.vnum% == 55214 Mecho The deer flees wildly at the sight of the blood-soaked rag! flee elseif %self.vnum% == 55244 mecho The deer boldly stands its ground, nostrils flaring at the scent of blood. end end end

triggers.name: wild-hunt deer flee
triggers.commands: * If drop the player is using the secret keyword to drop * the rag, flee!  Unfortunately, players can force the * deer to flee any time, so don't tell any of them this * keyword. return 0 if %actor.quest_stage[doom_entrance]% && %actor.quest_var[doom_entrance:wild_hunt]% == 1 && %arg% == ragtoscarewhitetaileddeer wait 1 set room %self.room% while %room% == %self.room% flee done endif

triggers.name: wild-hunt death
triggers.commands: * If this deer is the white hart, load the spirit of the white * hart who runs away from the questor. * If this deer is normal, load two more deer. * If this deer is the spirit of the white hart, load the antlers. if %self.vnum% == 55244 if %actor.quest_stage[doom_entrance]% == 1 return 0 mecho The spirit of the white hart breaks from the body and scampers off! mload mob 55245 endif elseif %self.vnum% == 55214 if %actor.quest_stage[doom_entrance]% == 1 eval room 55210 + %random.82% mat %room% mload mob 55214 eval room 55210 + %random.82% mat %room% mload mob 55214 endif elseif %self.vnum% == 55245 set i %actor.group_size% if %i% set a 1 else set a 0 endif while %i% >= %a% set person %actor.group_member[%a%]% if %person.room% == %self.room% if %person.quest_stage[doom_entrance]% == 1 quest advance doom_entrance %person.name% msend %person% &7&bYou have advanced the quest!&0 set load yes endif elseif %person% eval i %i% + 1 endif eval a %a% + 1 done if %load% == yes mload obj 48429 endif endif

triggers.name: wild-hunt-hold-rag
triggers.commands: *Like trigger 48418, only when they are not already holding the rag. if %actor.quest_stage[doom_entrance]% == 1 mforce %actor% hold ragtoscarewhitetaileddeer wait 1 if %self.vnum% == 55214 mecho The deer flees wildly at the sight of the blood-soaked rag! flee elseif %self.vnum% == 55244 mecho The deer boldly stands its ground, nostrils flaring at the scent of blood. end else return 0 end

%paralysis_victim_1.room% == %self.room% mechoaround %paralysis_victim_1% &2The crop of roots recedes, releasing %paralysis_victim_1.name% from its grasp.&0 msend %paralysis_victim_1% &2The crop of roots recedes, releasing you from its grasp.&0 else mecho &2The crop of roots recedes, releasing %paralysis_victim_1.name% from its grasp.&0 endif unset paralysis_victim_1 endif if %paralysis_victim_2% && ((%paralysis_victim_2.room% != %self.room%) || (%paralysis_expire_2% <= %now%)) * Clear paralysis on expired victim if %paralysis_victim_2.room% == %self.room% mechoaround %paralysis_victim_2% &2The crop of roots recedes, releasing %paralysis_victim_2.name% from its grasp.&0 msend %paralysis_victim_2% &2The crop of roots recedes, releasing you from its grasp.&0 else mecho &2The crop of roots recedes, releasing %paralysis_victim_2.name% from its grasp.&0 endif unset paralysis_victim_2 endif if %paralysis_victim_3% && ((%paralysis_victim_3.room% != %self.room%) || (%paralysis_expire_3% <= %now%)) * Clear paralysis on expired victim if %paralysis_victim_3.room% == %self.room% mechoaround %paralysis_victim_3% &2The crop of roots recedes, releasing %paralysis_victim_3.name% from its grasp.&0 msend %paralysis_victim_3% &2The crop of roots recedes, releasing you from its grasp.&0 else mecho &2The crop of roots recedes, releasing %paralysis_victim_3.name% from its grasp.&0 endif unset paralysis_victim_3 endif if %paralysis_victim_4% && ((%paralysis_victim_4.room% != %self.room%) || (%paralysis_expire_4% <= %now%)) * Clear paralysis on expired victim if %paralysis_victim_4.room% == %self.room% mechoaround %paralysis_victim_4% &2The crop of roots recedes, releasing %paralysis_victim_4.name% from its grasp.&0 msend %paralysis_victim_4% &2The crop of roots recedes, releasing you from its grasp.&0 else mecho &2The crop of roots recedes, releasing %paralysis_victim_4.name% from its grasp.&0 endif unset paralysis_victim_4 endif * 25% chance to do creeping doom proc set mode %random.4% if %mode% == 1 wait 2s m_run_room_trig 48503 halt endif * 75% chance to attempt to entangle if (!%paralysis_victim_1%) || (!%paralysis_victim_2%) || (!%paralysis_victim_3%) || (!%paralysis_victim_4%) if %paralysis_victim_1% if %paralysis_victim_2% if %paralysis_victim_3% if %paralysis_victim_4% * quit if four people already entangled halt else * 20% chance if three people are entangled set chance %random.10% endif else * 25% chance if two people are entangled set chance %random.8% endif else * 33% chance if one person is already entangled set chance %random.6% endif else * 50% chance if no one is already entangled set chance %random.4% endif if %chance% > 3 halt endif set max_tries 10 while %max_tries% >= 0 * find a victim, preferably an assassin * but will settle for any player if no assassin found set victim %random.char% if (%victim.vnum% == -1) if (%paralysis_victim_1% && (%paralysis_victim_1.name% == %victim.name%)) || (%paralysis_victim_2% && (%paralysis_victim_2.name% == %victim.name%)) || (%paralysis_victim_3% && (%paralysis_victim_3.name% == %victim.name%)) set victim %self% elseif (%victim.class% == Assassin) set max_tries 0 else set secondary_victim %victim% endif endif eval max_tries %max_tries% - 1 done * quit if no players if (%victim.vnum% == -1) elseif %secondary_victim% set victim %secondary_victim% else halt endif wait 2s mechoaround %victim% %self.name% snarls and waves a hand at the ground at %victim.name%'s feet. msend %victim% %self.name% snarls at you and waves a hand at the ground around your feet! mechoaround %victim% &2A crop of wriggling roots bursts from the ground, entangling %victim.name%!&0 msend %victim% &2A crop of wriggling roots bursts from the ground, entangling you!&0 * declare paralysis message set message &2The roots lock you in place, preventing movement!&0 global message * create a basher to force the player into a bashed stance if (%victim.size% == Small) || (%victim.size% == Tiny) * Basher is medium mload mob 48515 elseif (%victim.size% == Large) || (%victim.size% == Huge) || (%victim.size% == Giant) * Basher is huge mload mob 48513 else * Basher is large mload mob 48514 endif mforce bashing-roots mload obj 1016 mforce bashing-roots mat 1100 wear shield mforce %victim% stand mforce bashing-roots bash %victim.name% mforce bashing-roots mjunk shield mpurge bashing-roots * reinitiate combat if victim was tanking if %actor.name% == %victim.name% wait 2s kill %victim.name% endif * paralysis_expire_4 else set paralysis_victim_3 %victim% global paralysis_victim_3 eval paralysis_expire_3 %now% + 1 global paralysis_expire_3 endif else set paralysis_victim_2 %victim% global paralysis_victim_2 eval paralysis_expire_2 %now% + 1 global paralysis_expire_2 endif else set paralysis_victim_1 %victim% global paralysis_victim_1 eval paralysis_expire_1 %now% + 1 global paralysis_expire_1 endif endif

triggers.name: ice elemental lord - fight
triggers.commands: set chance %random.10% if %chance% > 5 wait 2s m_run_room_trig 48631 endif

triggers.name: ice elemental lord - damage
triggers.commands: * Hit half as many people are in the room set negatecold !COLD eval pop %self.people[count]% / 2 set max 15 set count 1 wecho &6&bThe Ice Elemental Lord crashes into the wall, bringing down a shower of ice!&0 while %count% <= %pop% set victim %random.char% * Don't hit the Ice Elemental Lord if %victim.vnum% != 48632 set flags %victim.aff_flags% * Base damage between 100 and 130 eval damage 100 + %random.30% if %flags% /= SANCT eval damage %damage% / 2 endif if %flags% /= WATERFORM * Heal players with waterform wsend %victim% &4&bThe falling ice melts into your body!&0 (&2%damage%&0) wechoaround %victim% &6%victim.name%'s body absorbs the falling ice!&0 (&3%damage%&0) wheal %victim% %damage% elseif (%flags% /= %negatecold%) || (%flags% /= PROT_COLD) * No effect for negate cold or elemental warding for ice wsend %victim% &6The falling ice bounces off your skin, settling lightly on the floor.&0 wechoaround %victim% &6The falling ice bounces off %victim.name%'s skin, settling lightly on the floor.&0 elseif %flags% /= FIRESHIELD * No effect for fireshield wsend %victim% &6The barrage of ice &3vaporizes&6 as it touches the &1flames&6 around your body!&0 wechoaround %victim% &6The barrage of ice &3vaporizes&6 on the &1flames&6 about %victim.name%'s body!&0 elseif %flags% /= BLUR * Decrease damage for blur eval damage %damage% - 35 wsend %victim% &6You dance through the barrage and only a few blocks of ice strike you!&0 (&1&b%damage%&0) wechoaround %victim% &6Dancing through the barrage, %victim.name% is struck by few ice blocks.&0 (&4%damage%&0) wdamage %victim% %damage% elseif %flags% /= FLY * Decrease damage for fly eval damage %damage% / 2 wsend %victim% &6You dart through the air, missing much of the falling ice!&0 (&1&b%damage%&0) wechoaround %victim% &6%victim.name% darts through the air, evading much of the falling ice!&0 (&4%damage%&0) wdamage %victim% %damage% elseif %flags% /= STONE * Increase damage for stone skin eval damage %damage% + 60 wsend %victim% &6Slowed by your stony skin, you are unable to dodge a slab of falling ice!&0 (&1&b%damage%&0) wechoaround %victim% &6Unable to dodge, %victim.name% takes the full brunt of the hail!&0 (&4%damage%&0) wdamage %victim% %damage% else * Hit everyone else wsend %victim% &6As you look up, a huge block of ice strikes you on the head!&0 (&1&b%damage%&0) wechoaround %victim% &6A hail of icy shards crashes down upon %victim.name%!&0 (&4%damage%&0) wdamage %victim% %damage% endif eval count %count% + 1 endif eval max %max% - 1 if %max% < 1 eval count %pop% + 1 endif done

triggers.name: ice elemental lord - greet
triggers.commands: if %self.aff_flagged[BLIND]% halt endif if %self.aff_flagged[COLDSHIELD]% mload obj 1160 mat 1100 quaff coldshield endif set coldproof %self.aff_flagged[!COLD]% if %coldproof% mload obj 1171 mat 1100 quaff negate-cold endif if %self.aff_flagged[WATERFORM]% mload obj 1178 mat 1100 quaff waterform endif

triggers.name: leviathan fight
triggers.commands: wait 2s set mode %random.10% if %mode% < 6 sweep else set victim %random.char% if (%victim.name% != %actor.name%) && ((%victim.class% == Warrior) || (%victim.class% /= Anti) || (%victim.class% == Ranger) || (%victim.class% == Paladin) || (%victim.class% == Monk) || (%victim.class% == Mercenary) || (%victim.class% == Berserker)) if %victim.room% == %self.room% mgoto 1100 mgoto %actor.room% mecho &7&bThe Leviathan thrashes about madly, switching opponents!&0 kill %victim.name% endif endif endif

triggers.name: leviathan block
triggers.commands: if %actor% && (%actor.vnum% == -1) && %self.people[48635]% && (%actor.level% < 100) wsend %actor% The colossal body of the Leviathan blocks your passage, throwing you back. return 0 endif

triggers.name: titan fight
triggers.commands: set action %random.10% if %action% > 7 * 30% chance to punch the tank wait 2s if %actor% && (%actor.room% == %self.room%) && (%actor.vnum% == -1) eval damage 300 + %random.50% if %actor.aff_flagged[SANCT]% eval damage %damage% / 2 endif if %actor.aff_flagged[STONE]% eval damage %damage% / 2 endif * Chance for critical hit set variant %random.15% if %variant% == 1 eval damage %damage% - 100 elseif %variant% == 15 eval damage %damage% + 200 endif if %damage% > 0 mdamage %actor% %damage% crush mechoaround %actor% %self.name% punches %actor.name% in the face, giving %actor.o% a black eye. (&3%damdone%&0) msend %actor% %self.name% punches you in the face. (&1&b%damdone%&0) else mechoaround %actor% %self.name% tries to punch %actor.name% in the face, but can't seem to make contact. msend %actor% %self.name% tries to punch you, but can't seem to make contact. end endif elseif (%action% > 4) * 30% chance to try to blind the room wait 1s emote clasps %get.obj_shortdesc[48424]% in his giant hands. mecho %get.obj_shortdesc[48424]% begins to &bglow&0 brightly. wait 2s mecho %get.obj_shortdesc[48424]% flares brightly, throwing blinding light in all directions! set room %self.room% set person %room.people% while %person% if %person.vnum% == -1 mcast blindness %person% 100 endif set person %person.next_in_room% done endif * 40% chance to do nothing

triggers.name: titan death
triggers.commands: if %self.wearing[48424]% * get rid of the staff sphere and load the key one mjunk timuns-golden-sphere mload obj 48422 endif

rooms.name: The Hall of Legends
rooms.description: This room's most immediate feature is the colorful murals which occupy the west and south walls.  What is immediately striking about the murals is that they are split into sections and seem to tell a story, much like chapters in a book.  The story seems to start on the west wall, then continue on the south wall.  Other than the murals, this room is empty.  There is an archway to the north, and a door to the east.  There is an inscription above the door.

extras.text: After spending several moments admiring the quality of the work focus shifts to discerning its meaning.  The murals along each wall are split into several scenes, each scene continuing a common story.  If you wish to examine the individual scenes, you must LOOK at mural1, then LOOK at mural2.

The scene on the west wall is dominated by a simple theme: a shadowy, vague presence stands unnoticed by other men, admiring a lovely young princess. Beneath the figures in the first scene are names: below the shadowy presence is the name Lokari, and below the princess is the name Irinia.

The mural on the south wall has many of the same elements as the mural to the west, but with a twist: the Princess is now aware that the shadow is observing her, and is discomforted by the fact.  In the final scene, Lokari asks the Princess to be his consort, but is refused.

The temple was raised to honor the gods, and the hall was raised to honor the memory of our great Quest.  Mortar and stone may crumble to dust, but blood and flesh will endure.  If the ages remember but one thing of our Quest, let it be this: our resolve never wavered, for we marched on the side of what was right and just.

rooms.name: The Hall of Legends
rooms.description: Along the west and east walls are the same type of colorful murals examined in the previous room.  The murals continue the story that began to the south. Examine the west wall first, if you wish to maintain the continuity of the story.  Exits from the room are through archways to the north and south.

extras.text: After spending several moments admiring the quality of the work focus shifts to discerning its meaning.  The murals along each wall are split into several scenes, each scene continuing a common story.  If you wish to examine the individual scenes, you must LOOK at mural1, then LOOK at mural2.

As you turn to the east, the images become dominated by Lokari.  In one scene, the god is perched thoughtfully upon a throne that floats in an inky blackness. Behind him stars streak across the void.  A silver radiance outlines Lokari's head; at first glance, the radiance appears to be a holy aura, but a closer inspection shows that the artisan has made the god's head eclipse the moon, so that only the very edges of the lunar body show.  It is then you recognize the name Lokari- he is the mysterious god of the Moonless Night.
Examining the west wall, you see various scenes in which the Princess rules her land.  She is pictured as a wise and benevolent ruler.

rooms.name: The Hall of Legends
rooms.description: The very first thing of note note in this room is the monstrous dragon's head fiercely glaring.  The crasftmanship of this artwork shows the mark of a master and one cannot help but marvel at the skill of the artisans.  More murals can be observed to the north and east.  The northern wall seems to continue the story where the chamber to the south left off.  There are archways to the west and south.

extras.text: After spending several moments admiring the quality of the work focus shifts to discerning its meaning.  The murals along each wall are split into several scenes, each scene continuing a common story.  If you wish to examine the individual scenes, you must LOOK at mural1, then LOOK at mural2.

The mural returns to the dragon's rape of the land. In this midst of this devastation one man stands forward and tracks the blue devil. The man is identified as Severan. There is a heroic battle; Severan slays the dragon, but is mauled by the beast as it flails madly about in its death throes. Severan is carried to a local temple by his retainers, where he is tended to by priests. When Princess Irinia hears of Severan's mighty deed, she rushes to the Champion's side, to offer her thanks.

Along the north wall, Lokari is shown in his godly domain, furious over his rejection by the Princess and brooding over how to win her favor.  In one chilling scene, Lokari grins madly, as though considering some insidious plan. The next scene shows Lokari unleashing a giant blue dragon upon the world. The dragon wreaks havoc upon Irinia's kingdom, ravishing everything in its path. The final scene depicts Lokari once again presenting himself to the Princess, this time with an offer: marry him and he will cage the dragon; deny him and the dragon will scourge the countryside and annihilate her people.

rooms.name: The Hall of Legends
rooms.description: As with every other chamber in this structure, there are murals along the walls, this time to the north and west.  The western murals are interrupted by an open window which looks out into the forest.  Perhaps at one time the window let in sunshine so that pilgrims could better view the murals; however, the window has proved just as effective at letting in the elements, for mud and decaying leaves litter the floor.  It may be wise to examine the mural to the west, then follow the story as it continues along the northern wall.  There are archways to the south and east.

extras.text: The inscription, which is part of the mural, appears to have been burned onto the stone wall of the chamber where the Princess was abducted. It reads: Gaze upon those who oppose my will and enjoy their folly.

After spending several moments admiring the quality of the work focus shifts to discerning its meaning.  The murals along each wall are split into several scenes, each scene continuing a common story.  If you wish to examine the individual scenes, you must LOOK at mural1, then LOOK at mural2.

This mural is very different from the others you have seen. The angles seem sharper, the colors less vibrant. Perhaps the artisans wished to emphasize the shock and loss expressed by the events depicted in this particular mural. Curious, you examine the mural in a desire to see how the story will unfold. The first scene shows Lokari peering into a window, watching the Princess as she and a few female companions huddle before a fireplace. Another mural shows Lokari entering the room and making his presence known to those inside. With a word and a gesture, he slays the terrified handmaidens. The final scene shows the god departing the mortal plane, forcing the Princess to accompany him. The lifeless bodies of the handmaidens and an inscription burned upon a stone wall in Irinia's room are all that remain behind to tell the tale of Irinia's abduction.

The mural reveals that Severan and the Princess spend much time together as his wounds heal.  The two fall in love and announce their plans to wed.  The entire kingdom celebrates upon hearing the news that their beloved Princess and their greatest Champion will be joined.  There is one figure who is not celebrating, however.  The shadowy Lokari stands in the background of every scene, anger and jealously blazing in his dark eyes.

rooms.name: The Hall of Legends
rooms.description: For the first time, physical damage to the room can be noticed.  The floor of this structure is uneven.  In the center of the chamber, the floor is polished smooth, while the corners are somewhat rougher.  Perhaps generations of pilgrims have worried the stone away with their boots, smoothing the floor out.  The continuin murals draw attention from the floor.  They continue along the west and east walls.  It may be wise to examine the west wall first, then the east.  There are archways to the north and south.

extras.text: After spending several moments admiring the quality of the work focus shifts to discerning its meaning.  The murals along each wall are split into several scenes, each scene continuing a common story.  If you wish to examine the individual scenes, you must LOOK at mural1, then LOOK at mural2.

This mural is somewhat hazy.  It depicts the awesome and powerful figures of three gods.  These gods seem to be debating.  At their feet a diminutive image of Severan is always present, as though in his piousness he has touched their hearts.  The gods, consequently, decide to assist Severan, and direct an avatar down to earth.  In the final scene, Severan seems encouraged as he listens closely to the words of the avatar.

This mural is entirely dedicated to displaying the panic, confusion, anger and despair which followed the abduction of the Princess. In the center of this tumult stands Severan. The Champion travels to a distant temple high in the mountains, where he seeks consultation with the gods. For seven days and nights he does nothing but fast, meditate, and sacrifice to the gods.

rooms.name: The Hall of Legends
rooms.description: The floor of this chamber is muddy and is littered with decaying leaves. There are murals to the west and east, and archways to the north and south. The mural to the west is interrupted by a window that looks out to a forest. It would be wise to examine the murals to the west before turning attention to the mural along the east wall.

extras.text: After spending several moments admiring the quality of the work focus shifts to discerning its meaning.  The murals along each wall are split into several scenes, each scene continuing a common story.  If you wish to examine the individual scenes, you must LOOK at mural1, then LOOK at mural2.

Severan returns to his people and shares with them the words of the avatar. The people are heartened by the news, and soon a mighty army forms. Heralds are dispatched to distant lands, and humanoids, heroes and intelligent monsters from across the world gather under Severan's banner. Personal allegiances are put aside; racial hatreds forgotten for the moment, as the mighty army grows and people begin to believe they can rescue the Princess and defeat the god.

Lokari is not idle as Severan gathers his army.  He assembles his own host and prepares the defense of his realm.  In several images you see Princess Irinia continuing to defy Lokari; this angers him, but he refuses to release her.

rooms.name: The Hall of Legends
rooms.description: As you enter this windowless room there is no clear indication how the ancients kept this structure illuminated.  No evidence of wall sconces for torches can be found, and there is a conspicuous lack of fireplaces.  Perhaps the ancients were afraid the smoke from these sources would damage the murals. There are murals on the west and east walls.  It may be wise to examine the wall to the west first.  There are archways to the north and south.

extras.text: After spending several moments admiring the quality of the work focus shifts to discerning its meaning.  The murals along each wall are split into several scenes, each scene continuing a common story.  If you wish to examine the individual scenes, you must LOOK at mural1, then LOOK at mural2.

The mural shows Severan's army growing even larger. Under Severan's direction, the army constructs a temple at the site of his victory over the dragon, incorporating the bones of the dragon into the foundation of the temple. You recognize the area depicted in the mural as being the compound you are currently exploring.

In this mural Severan and his army consult a number of oracles. The oracles impart some vital information to the Host. Apparently as a result of this information, Severan and several other Heroes leave the burgeoning army and set off in different directions.

rooms.name: The Hall of Legends
rooms.description: A breeze blows through a window along the west wall.  On the far side of the room, across the muddy floor, the mural continues on the south and west walls. It may be wise to examine the mural to the west first.  Exits from the room are through archways to the north and east.

extras.text: After spending several moments admiring the quality of the work focus shifts to discerning its meaning.  The murals along each wall are split into several scenes, each scene continuing a common story.  If you wish to examine the individual scenes, you must LOOK at mural1, then LOOK at mural2.

This mural shows Severan completing several Quests by which the gods test his worth.  Upon completing his final Quest, the three gods descend to the mortal realm and congratulate Severan upon his successes.  Warning Severan that his battle with Lokari will be a difficult, the gods give him their blessing.  You recognize the god- they are Timun the Sun god, Rhalean goddess of Justice, and Azkrael goddess of the Hunt.
This mural reveals that other Heroes Quested as well, and were just as successful as Severan. These heroes return home in triumph, bearing objects which they apparently won while Questing.

rooms.name: The Hall of Legends
rooms.description: The floor of this chamber is partially tiled.  The tiling begins to the north and ends abruptly in the center of the room.  Perhaps the artisans abandoned their attempts to cover the rough stone floor.  The tiles themselves are colorful and are decorated with images, but lack the mastery of the murals. The murals run along the east and south walls.  It may be wise to examine the east wall first.  There are archways to the north and west.

extras.text: After spending several moments admiring the quality of the work focus shifts to discerning its meaning.  The murals along each wall are split into several scenes, each scene continuing a common story.  If you wish to examine the individual scenes, you must LOOK at mural1, then LOOK at mural2.
In this mural, a great Host is seen to assemble before the Temple of the Sun. Swords flash brightly as men raise their weapons to salute Severan.

This murals shows only the Temple of the Sun.  The ground is muddy around the east face of the pyramid and appears heavily trodden.  You come to the conclusion that Severan has lead his Host to war against Lokari.
The tiles are purely decorative.

rooms.name: The Hall of Legends
rooms.description: The floor of this chamber is completely covered with tiles similar to those found to the south.  Some of the tiles have become brittle over the ages and care must be taken to step through the room to avoid fracturing them.  Unlike the other chambers, this room lacks murals.  Perhaps this chamber was intended to document Severan's triumphant return.  Perhaps Severan and his Host failed their war against the god.  There is a strange-looking door to the north.  The only other exit from the room is through an archway to the south.

North.description: The door's hinges are cleverly made. You suspect it opens only one-way.

extras.text: The tiles are purely decorative.

rooms.name: The Courtyard
rooms.description: The close-fitting stones of the courtyard have become fractured over time as stunted plants have forced their way through and around the stone.  To the east, at the other end of the courtyard, is a massive pyramid.  Stairs along the pyramid's western face will provide access to a temple on the top. Directly to the west is an elaborately decorated building.  There is a door to the west which will allow entrance into the structure.  The courtyard continues to the north, south, and east.

rooms.name: Before the Silveroak
rooms.description: Before you rises a fabled Silveroak tree.  The silver leaves of this tree reflect your light a hundred fold, flooding the surroundings with a silvery radiance so intense it is nearly blinding.  Surely the gods themselves must see this beacon and feel awe.  The courtyard was built around the tree, allowing the oak plenty of room in which to grow.  It appears that the ancient builders of this compound had a great deal of respect for this rare and wondrous tree. The courtyard continues to the north, east, and south.  To the west is an elaborately decorated building.

extras.text: The Silveroak...  Many stories have spawned of this legendary tree, but few have had the opportunity to view one.  It is said the Silveroak was the first tree planted upon the land by the gods after the world was created.

rooms.name: The Courtyard
rooms.description: The close-fitting stones of the courtyard have become fractured over time as stunted plants have forced their way through and around the stone.  To the east, at the other end of the courtyard, rises a massive tiered pyramid. Directly to the west there is a large rectangular building.  The courtyard continues to the north, east, and south.

rooms.name: The Courtyard
rooms.description: The pyramid directly to the east is formed from unadorned blocks of granite. Upon the final level of the tiered pyramid is a small, undecorated temple. The fact that the temple, like the pyramid, is barren of obvious artwork reflects the solemnness of either the builders of this structure or the god it was dedicated to.  The courtyard continues to the north, west, and south.

rooms.name: The Courtyard
rooms.description: A mighty pyramid which looms to the east.  It is composed of three distinct levels, each of which is smaller than the preceding one.  The base of the pyramid is the broadest and ends several meters above.  Upon the final level is perched a temple.  The courtyard continues to the north, west, and south.

rooms.name: The Courtyard
rooms.description: Directly to the east, a massive stairway cuts into the pyramid and provides easy access to the next level.  The stairway begins at the base of the pyramid and proceeds sharply upward.  The staircase leads upward, or the courtyard continues to the west, north, or south.

rooms.name: The Courtyard
rooms.description: At the base of the pyramid you spot a mighty block of granite bearing an inscription.  Examining the inscription, finds this structure was dedicated to Timun, god of the Sun, apparently in an attempt to beseech his aid for some purpose.  The courtyard continues to the north, west, and south.

extras.text: The inscription reads: Timun, great Lord of the Sun, we dedicate this temple to your name, to your philosophy, to your honour. We call upon you to help your loyal followers in their hour of greatest need.

rooms.name: The Courtyard
rooms.description: The pyramid directly to the east is formed from unadorned blocks of granite. Upon the final level of the tiered pyramid is a simple, undecorated temple. The fact that the temple, like the pyramid, is barren of obvious artwork reflects the solemnness of either the builders of this structure or the god it is dedicated to.  The courtyard continues to the north, west, and south.

rooms.name: The Courtyard
rooms.description: The close-fitting stones of the courtyard have become fractured over time as stunted plants have forced their way through and around the stone.  To the east, at the other end of the courtyard, rises a massive tiered pyramid. Directly to the west lies large rectangular building.  The courtyard continues to the north, east, and south.

rooms.name: The Fountain
rooms.description: A large fountain lies here.  The fountain is dry now, its basin filled with mud and leaves.  Along the base you spot an inscription.  A statue stands on a platform in the middle of the fountain.  The statue faces to the east, its eyes peering up at a temple situated upon the top of the pyramid.  The statue's expression and stance express supplication, but a sheathed sword is gripped tightly in one hand.  The courtyard continues to the north, east, and south. There is a building directly to the west.

extras.text: Following the statue's eyes it can be seen that he is looking up at a temple upon the pyramid.  The statue's dress suggests that he is a mighty warrior, but his bearing indicates that he is pious.

An inscription on the fountain reads: Concept, Compound, Earth, Water and Fire -- Rhalean 1996 Air and Keep, Plus Many Ideas -- Azkrael 1996 Hard Work, Clever Coding, and Dedication -- Metamorpho 1992- present. Editing for Reimplementation -- Kourrya, Dakhod, Laoris and Cronax 2006

rooms.name: Hall of Nobility
rooms.description: A large mural vies for attention and dominates the room.  It is amazing and spans the entire ceiling.  The mural is crowded with images of paladins, monsters, and fair maidens.  In the centre of the ceiling is the image of a paladin who appears much taller and more powerful than the others.  The warrior stands before a rising sun, and his armour reflects the sunlight and shines with a golden radiance.  Next to the paladin stands a beautiful young woman garbed in a wedding gown, and at his feet is a stone tablet.  The tablet is inscribed with writing but at this distance only one line can be seen, the line which is larger than the rest.  The phrase reads: 'The Code of the Paladin.  ' Moving closer to the tablet may provide a better vantage point for reading. There is an archway to the west and a door to the east.

extras.text: The woman is garbed in a wedding gown and has one hand placed protectively upon her husband's arm, the paladin.  There is a tiny script beneath her.  It reads: Nikita, wife of Timun, great Lord of the Sun.

There is something unusual about the paladin in the centre of the ceiling. His bearing and stance display absolute strength of sword and conviction. Ancient lore claims that Timun, god of the Sun, is the patron deity of the Paladin Guild...  Perhaps this mural was created to honour him.

The inscription reads: The Code of the Paladin: Know that this is the Code of the Paladin, as told by the great god Timun to the First Paladin, Irik. The Paladin will defend the weak against the wicked, respect the Gods and do them honour, and willingly sacrifice his life to protect the virtues of a maiden.

rooms.name: Oracle of the Sun
rooms.description: The diffuse blue glow of the altar dominates the centre of the room.  The walls are of pure white marble, untouched by the light of the altar.  A quick glance upwards reveals a marvel of art or magic.  Black as the darkest night, its depths are broken only by motes of light that sparkle and dance before your eyes.  It is as if the ceiling captures the very essence of stars, reflecting the beauty of the night.  Floating just out of reach above the altar is a large, golden disk.  It rotates slowly, revealing a rayed sun symbol engraved on one side, and an eagle holding a sword in its claws on the other.  As you examine the emblem it suddenly a shoots a ray of sunlight against the west wall.  The image the disk projects against the wall seems almost solid.  The only visible exit from this chamber is to the east.

West.description: The door is made of light! It is as solid as steel and something tells you the door is indestructible.

extras.text: Upon closer inspection specific constellations can be seen on the ceiling far above!  It really is a reflection of the stars.  One constellation seems to garner more attention than the rest....  The Paladin and his Sword.  Could there be a connection?
The pool seems to swirl and form vague, fleeting images.  You get the impression of legends being made, stories being written, but it passes too fast to catch.

The symbols seem to reform, rearrange and sometimes reshape themselves. Somehow, the symbols seems to form words in your mind... I am the Star-Gazer, Worldmaker, Walker of Storms, I walked as Tale-Spinner, Truthseeker, Bearer of... The rest is lost, beyond mortal comprehension. This must belong to a God, only they could be so arrogant.

The altar is nothing more than a huge rectangular slab of white marble, but it radiates light from somewhere within itself. A circular pool filled with some sort of liquid is cut into its surface. Inscribed on the sides are symbols which looks vaguely familiar.

Passing a hand through the light it is surprising to find resistance to movement.  The light has the consistency of a thick soup.  The further away from the disk, the more solid the light becomes.  Placing a hand into the light ray as it nears the west wall the faint outline of your skeleton can be seen!
The disk is made of pure gold and throbs with power. It projects a ray of light onto the west wall. The light forms into a shape which resembles a door.

rooms.name: The Arch of Bones
rooms.description: Along the west wall of this chamber is a magnificent structure: an archway, built from the bones of a monstrous, powerful animal.  A dragon's skull projects from the apex of the arch.  This archway must have been built using the bones of the blue dragon which Severan defeated in battle.  Attempting to peer beyond the archway is futile, as it is unnaturally darkened.  There are no indications where it leads.  The surface glimmers as ripples spread across its silvery surface.  There is a feeling the archway will not lead to another chamber, or to any other Cailian destination, for that matter.  There is no other exit from the chamber.

West.description: The surface of the arch appears liquid and flowing, but solid to the touch, preventing passage through the membrane.  It would be unwise to use force, lest the bones of the arch come tumbling down.

rooms.name: Hall of Justice
rooms.description: Stone statues line both sides of this hall.  The statues to the east carry swords at their waist and possess grim faces and an unyielding stance.  The statues to the west are dressed in the robes of a magistrate and cradle a book in one arm.  There is a chamber at the south end of this hall.  Exit north is possible through a stone door.

rooms.name: Oracle of Justice
rooms.description: This chamber is so holy to a god that it has absorbed part of her essence, and radiates it as the sun radiates light.  Never before has there been so strong a presence of Divinity.  The room is unadorned, lacking even a simple altar.  The only exit is to the north.

rooms.name: The Hall of the Hunt
rooms.description: Soft noises echo off of the alabaster-tiled floor.  A long hall leads to what is clearly a throne of sorts at the very end of the room.  Tapestries line the walls, tall as a tree in a forest.  The ceiling is all glass, with an unwordly blue moonlight showing through, reflecting on the floor, until silver shafts of light dance along the walls.  This is the Hall of the Hunt, where Severan and other mortals begged the mighty Azkrael, Goddess of the Hunt, for her aid against the insane Lokari.  Azkrael's touch upon this room is evident. This Hall must co-exists in a godly realm, and that the moonlight filtering down from the ceiling is the same light that illuminates Azkrael's domain. The Hall continues north through an archway.  There is an exit the pyramid by leaving south through a stone door.

rooms.name: Oracle of the Hunt
rooms.description: The goddess must have listened to the pleas of the mortals, because here is her answer: a beautiful chamber, blessed with her obvious presence.  Six greyhounds are sprawled along the floor near a wall, lost in immortal sleep. Advancing through the chamber, the wildness of the Hunt infectious.  A feral grin forms on your lips without your even being aware of it.  Even the greyhounds notice it, waking up and observing the intrusion.  Roses on trellises all along the walls bloom, springing to life.  Truly this is a sacred and holy place, a fitting altar to the Goddess of the Hunt.  At the end of the chamber is an empty throne composed of silver and ivory.  The only exit is to the south.

rooms.name: The Courtyard
rooms.description: This is the northern edge of a narrow courtyard which separates two ancient structures.  Along the east flank of the courtyard is a tiered pyramid.  The pyramid is constructed from massive blocks of unadorned granite.  The building west of the courtyard is much more elaborate than the pyramid, with engraved columns and friezes running its length.  Directly to the east, you see a grassy area that skirts the edge of the temple.  The courtyard continues to the south and west.

rooms.name: Along a Side of the Pyramid
rooms.description: This area is a grassy, narrow alley that continues in an east-west direction and separates the pyramid to the south from the forest to the north.

rooms.name: Along a Side of the Pyramid
rooms.description: This area is a grassy, narrow alley that continues in an east-west direction and separates the pyramid to the south from the forest to the north.

rooms.name: Along a Side of the Pyramid
rooms.description: Continuing along the grassy path there appears to be an irregularity in the shape of the pyramid.  Examining the stone closely, there seems to be a door which will provide access to the interior.

South.description: The door is made of the same stone as the pyramid and projects out from the pyramid somewhat.

rooms.name: Along a Side of the Pyramid
rooms.description: This area is a grassy, narrow alley that continues in an east-west direction and separates the pyramid to the south from the forest to the north.

rooms.name: Along a Side of the Pyramid
rooms.description: This area is a grassy, narrow alley that continues in an east-west direction and separates the pyramid to the south from the forest to the north.

rooms.name: Along a Side of the Pyramid
rooms.description: This is the edge of the pyramid.  The forest presses closely against the path here to the east and north, seeking to reclaim land lost to humanity generations ago.  The grassy path continues to the west and south.

rooms.name: Along a Side of the Pyramid
rooms.description: This area is a grassy, narrow alley that continues in an north-south direction and separates the pyramid to the west from the forest to the east.

rooms.name: Along a Side of the Pyramid

rooms.description: This area is a grassy, narrow alley that continues in an west-east direction and separates the pyramid to the north from the forest to the south.
