rooms.name: Along a Side of the Pyramid
rooms.description: This area is a grassy, narrow alley that continues in an west-east direction and separates the pyramid to the north from the forest to the south.

rooms.name: Along a Side of the Pyramid
rooms.description: This area is a grassy, narrow alley that continues in an west-east direction and separates the pyramid to the north from the forest to the south.

rooms.name: The Courtyard
rooms.description: This is the southern edge of a narrow courtyard which separates two ancient structures.  Along the east flank of the courtyard is a tiered pyramid.  The pyramid is constructed from massive blocks of unadorned granite.  The building west of the courtyard is much more elaborate than the pyramid, with engraved columns and friezes running its length.  Directly to the east, there is a grassy area that skirts the edge of the temple.  The courtyard continues to the north and west.

rooms.name: First Level of the Pyramid
rooms.description: The steps of this staircase are treacherous.  Proceed slowly, knowing that a fall would be easy and quite possibly fatal.  The edges of the stairs are worn at the center, as though generations of pilgrims and priests have worn the stone away.  The staricase continues up or down.

rooms.name: Second Level of the Pyramid
rooms.description: The second level of the pyramid provides an excellent view of the countryside.  To the west lies the Hall and the deep green heart of the forest. A stiff breeze sweeps the trees forward; for a moment, the trees resemble great waves rushing towards the compound, threatening to wash over the courtyard and reclaim the land for the forest.  The staircase continues in a vertical direction.

rooms.name: Altar to the Sun God
rooms.description: Upon the final level of the pyramid is a temple.  The temple is barren with the exception of an impressive ivory altar which rests beneath a skylight. The center of the altar is inlaid with gold beaten into the form of a sun. The altar has evidently gone unused for a very long time, but is still sacred to a god, for the area retains a sense of importance and holiness.

rooms.name: Above an Ancient Forest
rooms.description: An ancient forest, surrounded by hills on all sides, sprawls to the north. The rolling hills contain the forest, limiting its boundaries and preventing it from expaning.  Here, above the woods, the forest can be seen in its entirety. In the middle of the great forest, east of the forest heart, there is a massive stone pyramid rising above the trees.  Far below, the hill continues and toward the edge of the forest, or the Eldorian Hills can be reached by traveling south.

rooms.name: Edge of an Ancient Forest
rooms.description: To the north, a stark line of trees marks the beginning of an ancient forest.  The trees grow closely together, but an old path, seldom used these days, will provide easy travel through the forest.  At your back rises a gentle, rolling hill.

rooms.name: A Path Through an Ancient Forest
rooms.description: The trail cuts through the woods, passing through dappled sunlight and twisting around the trunks of the great forest trees.  A small songbird, peering up from a branch high overhead, notices the intrusion and responds with the eruption of a sudden chorus.  The bird's song is answered by others of its kind, and soon the forest resounds with the melody.  As suddenly as it began, the birds cease their song, leaving the forest deathly quite.  The trail continues to the north and south.

rooms.name: A Path Through an Ancient Forest
rooms.description: A thick carpet of decaying leaves blanket the path, forcing travel to proceed slowly to prevent a mistep that will lead away from the real path and onto a false trail.  The trail continues to the south and west.

rooms.name: A Path Through an Ancient Forest
rooms.description: Muted sunlight filters through the canopy of branches and leaves overhead, leaving much of the forest in shadow.  Occasional shafts of golden sunlight streak through the canopy untouched, highlighting certain areas of the forest and drawing your attention to the abundant and varied life.  The path continues to the west and east.

rooms.name: A Path Through an Ancient Forest
rooms.description: Muted sunlight filters through the canopy of branches and leaves overhead, leaving much of the forest in shadow.  Occasional shafts of golden sunlight streak through the canopy untouched, highlighting certain areas of the forest and drawing attention to the abundant and varied life.  The path continues to the east.  To the north the path ends abruptly at a swift-flowing creek, but a stone bridge allows access over the water.

rooms.name: The Stone Bridge
rooms.description: An ancient bridge spans a deep, swift creek which winds its way through the forest here.  The bridge is wide enough for five men to walk abreast and was obviously designed to facilitate the transportation of troops- simple farmers or villagers would not construct a bridge so wide and sturdy.  The bridge is also well-crafted, and examining the stonework it is characteristic of dwarven masonry technique.  The bridge continues to the north, or the path can be reached to the south.  Directly below is the bank of the creek.  It is possible to enter the area underneath the bridge and further explore if desired.

rooms.name: The Courtyard
rooms.description: The corner of the courtyard is here, which extends to the south and east. The forest to the north and west press closely to the edge of the courtyard, seeking to reclaim land lost to humanity centuries ago.  Glancing at the stones under foot, small shoots and young saplings can be seen forcing their way around the edge of the stones, creating fractures in the courtyard.  Perhaps in a hundred years all traces of the courtyard will be obliterated as the stones are supplanted by life

rooms.name: The Courtyard
rooms.description: The corner of the courtyard is here, which extends to the north and east. The forest to the south and west press closely to the edge of the courtyard, seeking to reclaim land lost to humanity centuries ago.  Glancing at the stones underfoot, small shoots and young saplings can be seen forcing their way around the edge of the stones, creating fractures in the courtyard.  Perhaps in a hundred years all traces of the courtyard will be obliterated as the stones are supplanted by life.  An old trail leading south can be seen cutting into the woods.

rooms.name: The Stone Tablet
rooms.description: There is a clearing in the forest here. In the center of the clearing towers an enormous stone tablet. There is writing on the tablet, and before you proceed, you MUST look at the tablet. Congratulations! You have successfully teleported to a room which was never connected, because the policies regarding Severan's Doom were changed. Aren't YOU special!

extras.text: The tablet is written in an elegant script. It reads: Severan's Doom was created to present a challenge to the many high level characters in the game. It was designed for groups of 5-6 level 90+ PC's. If you are a whiner, please proceed no further, for this area is definitely not for you: it is dangerous. If you don't like danger, go back to killing bunnies. Severan's Doom was designed to be dangerous, but fair. There *are* rewards for exploring the area, aside from the usual gold and xp. These rewards (powerful items) were created to offset the high casualty rate. However, these items should only be given to those players who demonstrate their worth by exploring the area and braving the unknown. Therefore, we have instituted the following rules: 1) under no circumstances, do not give other players a map, or verbal directions, to any location within this area. 2) do NOT give equipment from this area away to other people. Do NOT sell these items to other players. I repeat- they *must* get the items themselves! 3) god and immortals will not 'explore' this area while invisible. Unlike other MUDs, Fiery does not allow its gods/immortals to run amok over the MUD and discover the game's secrets the easy way. 4) ignorance of these rules is not an excuse to violate them. Thank you for respecting these rules. To be honest, a lot of the above rules will be hard to enforce... but we feel confident the majority of players have the integrity to police themselves. However, if you are caught violating the rules, Lokari himself just might summon you to Oblivion.

rooms.name: The Stone Bridge
rooms.description: You stand on the middle of the bridge and peer into the distance, tracking the creek as it runs from east to west.  Trout and other aquatic creatures can be heard jumping in the water directly below.  The path continues along the bridge to the north and south.

rooms.name: The Stone Bridge
rooms.description: This is the northern end of the stone bridge which spans a swift-flowing creek.  There is an inscription carved into the bridge.  The creek is a deep blue in color, pure and unpolluted by either mud or debris.  There is a forest trail to the north, leading away from the bridge.

extras.text: The inscription has been expertly chiseled into the stone. It reads: Selina, Spirit of the Water, allow us safe passage over your swift currents. Let not your raging torrents tear this bridge from its foundation, nor wash soldiers from its surface, for we are your humble servants, just as we are servants of all the gods. Severan

rooms.name: A Path Through an Ancient Forest
rooms.description: Muted sunlight filters through the canopy of branches and leaves overhead, leaving much of the forest in shadow.  Occasional shafts of golden sunlight streak through the canopy untouched, highlighting certain areas of the forest and drawing attention to the abundant and varied life around.  The path continues to the east, and roaring water from a swift-flowing creek can be heard to the south.  A stone bridge will allow easy access over the water.

rooms.name: A Path Through an Ancient Forest
rooms.description: The trail before you cuts through the woods, passing through dappled sunlight and twisting around the trunks of the great forest trees.  The air is very heavy here, but lacks an oppressive quality.  It is more of a stillness, as though this forest is so ancient it may resist the power of the elements. This seems so natural that it would be surprising to detect even a faint stirring of the wind.  The path continues to the west and east.

rooms.name: A Path Through an Ancient Forest
rooms.description: The trail before you cuts through the woods, passing through dappled sunlight and twisting around the trunks of the great forest trees.  The forest is still, and even the sound of forest animals is muted.  The silence does not seem ominous at all, but rather reverent, like the stillness of a holy place. The path continues to the north and south.

A pyramid can be seen to the north, towering above the tree line.  The pyramid is tiered, rising incrementally in steps.  The path continues to the north and south.

rooms.description: The trail before you cuts through the woods, passing through dappled sunlight and twisting around the trunks of the great forest trees.  A pyramid can be seen to the north, towering above the tree line.  The pyramid is tiered, rising incrementally in steps.  The path continues to the north and south.

rooms.description: The trail before you cuts through the woods, passing through dappled sunlight and twisting around the trunks of the great forest trees.  A pyramid can be seen to the north, towering above the tree line.  The pyramid is tiered, rising incrementally in steps.  The path continues to the south.  To the north, you see the beginning of a courtyard.

rooms.name: Beneath a Stone Bridge
rooms.description: You are underneath a stone bridge which spans a deep, swift-flowing creek. You are on the southern bank of the creek, surrounded by weeds and stunted plants.  The area directly under the bridge is rocky, and the ground is scarred with scorchmarks from a campfire, and littered with ash and bits of half-burned wood.  Examining the area closely, you find a few large, well-chewed bones.
